etymology.description: phono-semantic compound: semantic 囗 (“enclosure”) + phonetic 君 (jūn).
etymology.interpretation: Enclosure hints at a place for keeping things, while 君 supplies the sound. Together they point to grain gathered and stored within an enclosure, hence a granary or grain stack.

examples.chinese: 门前的稻谷堆成一个大囷(門前的稻穀堆成一個大囷)。
examples.pinyin: Ménqián de dàogǔ duī chéng yí ge dà qūn.
examples.english: The rice was piled into a big grain stack in front of the gate.

examples.chinese: 村里修了新囷，用来储存小麦(村裡修了新囷，用來儲存小麥)。
examples.pinyin: Cūn lǐ xiū le xīn qūn, yòng lái chǔcún xiǎomài.
examples.english: The village built a new granary to store wheat.

examples.chinese: 秋后，粮食被收进囷中防潮(秋後，糧食被收進囷中防潮)。
examples.pinyin: Qiū hòu, liángshi bèi shōu jìn qūn zhōng fáng cháo.
examples.english: After autumn, the grain is brought into the granary to keep out moisture.
